DOC.brief_summary: Low intensity laser therapy ( LILT ) widely apply pain relief several clinical situation . With advent new LED-based ( light emit diode ) light source , need clinical experiment aim compare effectiveness paramount .
DOC.brief_title: Analgesic Effects LED Light Temporomandibular Disorders .
DOC.detailed_description: Aims : Low intensity laser therapy ( LILT ) widely apply pain relief several clinical situation . With advent new LED-based ( light emit diode ) light source , need clinical experiment aim compare effectiveness paramount . Method : This study propose evaluation analgesic effect TMD ( temporomandibular disorder ) use two different LEDs system , one emit spectral band red ( 630 +/-5 nm ) infrared band ( 850 +/-5 nm ) , compare result laser treated control group ( 780nm diode laser use 105.7 J/cm2 ) . Mandibular range motion report pain evaluate via appropriate equipment develop end . Power output 150mW , tip area 0.5 cm² source . Fluency dose choose 18 J/cm² point application , around TMJ , side . Five point irradiate TMJ , temporal masseter muscle . Eight irradiation session do follow perform 7 30 day , last session . Thirty patient enrol select randomly treatment , result 10 patient per group ( infrared LED , red LED Control Group use infrared Laser ) .
DOC.criteria: Thirty patient ( 18 50 year old ) presenting sign symptom TMD select participate study . The patient receive care private dental office Ribeirao Preto , São Paulo , Brazil ( NILO Integrated Center Laser Dentistry ) . The patients´ age range 18 40 year old , 08 male 22 female . The sign symptom evaluate trained professional follow : pain palpation TMJ area , pain associate muscle ( masseter temporal ) , limited painful jaw movement impaired oral aperture . The exclusion criterion patient currently orthodontic and/or orthopedic treatment , degenerative joint disease , patient systemic medication antiinflammatory drug , analgesic treatment , muscle relaxant corticosteroid .
